      • generateX509CertificateV3SelfSignedRootChain

        public static org.bouncycastle.cert.X509CertificateHolder generateX509CertificateV3SelfSignedRootChain​(org.bouncycastle.asn1.x500.X500Name issuerDN,
                                                                                                       java.security.KeyPair keys,
                                                                                                       java.util.Date validAfter,
                                                                                                       java.util.Date expireDate,
                                                                                                       int pathLenConstraint)
                                                                                                throws CertificateLtException
        Generates a X.509 certificate version 3 - self signed (root for a chain of certificates).
        Parameters:
        issuerDN - common name
        keys -
        validAfter - the date and time after which the certificate is valid
        expireDate - the date and time after which the certificate expires
        pathLenConstraint - specifies the depth of the certification path (if >-1 create as certificate authority)
        Returns:
        generated certificate
        Throws:
        CertificateLtException -
        +Cause OperatorCreationException

      • generateCSR

        public static org.bouncycastle.asn1.pkcs.CertificationRequest generateCSR​(java.security.PublicKey publicKey,
                                                                          org.bouncycastle.asn1.x500.X500Name distinguishedName,
                                                                          SignatureEnum signatureAlgorithm,
                                                                          java.security.PrivateKey privateKey)
                                                                   throws CertificateLtException
        Constructs a certificate sign request.
        Parameters:
        publicKey - the public key that should be placed into the certificate generated by the CA
        distinguishedName - X.500 names to identify entity
        signatureAlgorithm - signature algorithm
        privateKey - the private key of the identity whose signature is going to be generated
        Returns:
        pkcs10 certificate request
        Throws:
        CertificateLtException -
        +Cause OperatorCreationException

      • isValidX509

        public static boolean isValidX509​(org.bouncycastle.cert.X509CertificateHolder certificate,
                                  org.bouncycastle.crypto.params.AsymmetricKeyParameter keyTrust)
                           throws CertificateLtException
        Verifies that the certificate was signed using the private key that corresponds to the specified public key.
        Also verifies the current date and time are within the validity period given in the certificate.
        Parameters:
        certificate - X509
        keyTrust - the trusted public key used to carry out the verification
        Returns:
        true if is valid
        Throws:
        CertificateLtException -
        +Cause OperatorCreationException
        +Cause CertException - if the signature cannot be processed or is inappropriate

      • isValidX509

        public static boolean isValidX509​(org.bouncycastle.cert.X509CertificateHolder certificate,
                                  org.bouncycastle.cert.X509CertificateHolder issuerCertificate)
                           throws CertificateLtException
        Verifies that the certificate was signed using the private key that corresponds to the specified public key from issuer certificate.
        Also verifies the current date and time are within the validity period given in the certificate.
        Parameters:
        certificate - X509
        issuerCertificate - the trusted public key used to carry out the verification
        Returns:
        true if is valid
        Throws:
        CertificateLtException -
        +Cause OperatorCreationException
        +Cause CertException - if the signature cannot be processed or is inappropriate

      • isValidChain

        public static boolean isValidChain​(org.bouncycastle.cert.X509CertificateHolder[] chain)
                            throws CertificateLtException
        Verifies that the root certificate in the chain is self-signed.
        And all consecutive certificates were signed using the private key that corresponds to the public key in anterior certificate.
        Also verifies if the current date and time are within the validity period given in all the certificates.
        Parameters:
        chain - with the certificates to verify
        Returns:
        true if is valid
        Throws:
        CertificateLtException -
        +Cause OperatorCreationException
        +Cause CertException - if the signature cannot be processed or is inappropriate

      • addLink

        public static org.bouncycastle.cert.X509CertificateHolder[] addLink​(org.bouncycastle.cert.X509CertificateHolder[] chain,
                                                                    java.security.PrivateKey chain0PrivateKey,
                                                                    java.util.Date validAfter,
                                                                    java.util.Date expireDate,
                                                                    org.bouncycastle.asn1.pkcs.CertificationRequest requestLink)
                                                             throws CertificateLtException
        Creates a new certificate from the requestLink and adds it to the chain.
        Parameters:
        chain -
        chain0PrivateKey - the private key correspondent to the certificate in index 0 (will be used to sign the new link)
        validAfter -
        expireDate -
        requestLink -
        Returns:
        a new array with the new link
        Throws:
        CertificateLtException -
        +Cause CertificateChainLtException if issuer is not a CA or valid date interval is invalid for the issuer or pathLenConstraint is invalid
        +Cause OperatorCreationException

      • addLink

        public static org.bouncycastle.cert.X509CertificateHolder[] addLink​(org.bouncycastle.cert.X509CertificateHolder[] chain,
                                                                    java.security.PrivateKey chain0PrivateKey,
                                                                    SignatureEnum signatureAlgorithm,
                                                                    java.math.BigInteger serialNumber,
                                                                    java.util.Date validAfter,
                                                                    java.util.Date expireDate,
                                                                    org.bouncycastle.asn1.pkcs.CertificationRequest requestLink,
                                                                    int pathLenConstraint)
                                                             throws CertificateLtException
        Creates a new certificate from the requestLink and adds it to the chain.
        Parameters:
        chain -
        chain0PrivateKey - the private key correspondent to the certificate in index 0 (will be used to sign the new link)
        signatureAlgorithm -
        serialNumber -
        validAfter -
        expireDate -
        requestLink -
        pathLenConstraint - specifies the depth of the certification path (if >-1 create as certificate authority)
        Returns:
        a new array with the new link
        Throws:
        CertificateLtException -
        +Cause CertificateChainLtException if issuer is not a CA or valid date interval is invalid for the issuer or pathLenConstraint is invalid
        +Cause OperatorCreationException

      • generateLinkedX509CertificateV3

        public static org.bouncycastle.cert.X509CertificateHolder generateLinkedX509CertificateV3​(org.bouncycastle.asn1.pkcs.CertificationRequest csr,
                                                                                          org.bouncycastle.cert.X509CertificateHolder issuerCertificate,
                                                                                          java.security.PrivateKey issuerPrivateKey,
                                                                                          java.util.Date validAfter,
                                                                                          java.util.Date expireDate)
                                                                                   throws CertificateLtException
        Generates a X.509 certificate version 3, signed by CA issuer.
        Parameters:
        csr - certificate sign request
        issuerCertificate - CA certificate
        issuerPrivateKey - key used to sign
        validAfter - the date and time after which the certificate is valid
        expireDate - the date and time after which the certificate expires
        Returns:
        the new certificate
        Throws:
        CertificateLtException -
        +Cause CertificateChainLtException if issuer is not a CA or valid date interval is invalid for the issuer or pathLenConstraint is invalid
        +Cause OperatorCreationException

      • generateLinkedX509CertificateV3

        public static org.bouncycastle.cert.X509CertificateHolder generateLinkedX509CertificateV3​(org.bouncycastle.asn1.pkcs.CertificationRequest csr,
                                                                                          org.bouncycastle.cert.X509CertificateHolder issuerCertificate,
                                                                                          java.security.PrivateKey issuerPrivateKey,
                                                                                          SignatureEnum signatureAlgorithm,
                                                                                          java.math.BigInteger serialNumber,
                                                                                          java.util.Date validAfter,
                                                                                          java.util.Date expireDate,
                                                                                          int pathLenConstraint)
                                                                                   throws CertificateLtException
        Generates a X.509 certificate version 3, signed by CA issuer.
        Parameters:
        csr - certificate sign request
        issuerCertificate - CA certificate
        issuerPrivateKey - key used to sign
        signatureAlgorithm - the name of the signature algorithm used
        serialNumber - the serial number for the certificate
        validAfter - the date and time after which the certificate is valid
        expireDate - the date and time after which the certificate expires
        pathLenConstraint - specifies the depth of the certification path (if >-1 create as certificate authority)
        Returns:
        the new certificate
        Throws:
        CertificateLtException -
        +Cause CertificateChainLtException if issuer is not a CA or valid date interval is invalid for the issuer or pathLenConstraint is invalid
        +Cause OperatorCreationException
